title: Ideal Gas Law - volume and rms speed

content.question: The figure shows an ideal gas in a cylindrical container with a piston that can move with negligible friction. The container is placed in hot water that is kept at a constant temperature. As the gas reaches thermal equilibrium with the water, the root-mean-square speed of the gas atoms doubles while the gas pressure remains constant. Which of the following is equal to <math alttext="V sub f to V sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math>, the ratio of the final volume <math alttext="V sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> to the initial volume <math alttext="V sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math>?
